chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Margaret J Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Consecutive to: 14CM166

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1 & 2.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Count 3 DRI.  Victim makes a statement to the Court.  DA and defense argue as to sentence.  Court orders 1 year jail on Ct 1 and 90 days concurrent on Ct 2.  $10 fine plus costs on both and DNA surcharge.
Notice of Motion and motion to dismiss (insufficient Preliminary)
